title: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Makes History With Closest Pass to Sun - Science@NASA
summary:
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Makes History With Closest Pass to Sun

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NASA Science

The Parker Solar Probe has accomplished a historic milestone by making the closest-ever approach to the Sun.

  • The Parker Solar Probe traveled within a remarkable distance of the Sun's surface.
  • This mission aims to gather data on solar winds and the Sun's atmosphere.
  • The probe's findings could enhance understanding of solar behavior and its impact on Earth.
“This mission represents a groundbreaking achievement in solar exploration,” said a NASA spokesperson.

This event marks a significant step in space exploration, providing insights that could shape future solar research.
newTitle: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Makes History With Closest Pass to Sun

Blood transfusions can help save heart attack patients with anemia: Study - The Times of India
summary:
Blood transfusions can help save heart attack patients with anemia: Study

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: NEJM Evidence

A recent study indicates that blood transfusions are life-saving for anemic individuals after a heart attack, showing a reduced risk of death within six months for those receiving more transfusions.

  • Anemia affects about one-third of congestive heart failure cases and raises heart attack risk.
  • Patients with fewer transfusions had a 9.3% death rate within 30 days compared to 8.1% for those receiving more transfusions.
  • Heart-related deaths were 5.5% for fewer transfusions vs. 3.7% for those with more transfusions.
  • Over 4,300 patients' data from four trials were analyzed for the study.
“The results of this analysis show that giving more blood to anemic patients with heart attacks can save lives at six months.” - Dr. Jeffrey Carson

While blood transfusions can significantly benefit anemic heart attack patients, caution is advised due to potential risks such as infection or fluid buildup.
newTitle: Study Shows Blood Transfusions Benefit Anemic Heart Attack Patients

  • They highlighted the perceived disrespect shown during the last rites and memorial services.
  • The outcry reflects broader tensions between the central government and opposition parties.
“It is shocking and a deliberate insult to the legacy of Manmohan Singh.” - Congress Leader

This incident has sparked significant political discussions regarding the treatment of former leaders and the role of the central government in memorializing their contributions.
newTitle: Congress and SAD Criticize Centre Over Manmohan Singh's Last Rites

title: NASA's Parker Solar Probe ‘safe’ after record-breaking brush with scorching surface, ‘phones home’ after several days | Mint - Mint
summary:
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe ‘safe’ after record-breaking brush with scorching surface, ‘phones home’ after several days

Publication Date: Recent Update | Source: NASA

The Parker Solar Probe has successfully survived its closest approach to the Sun, reaching within 6 million kilometers of the star’s surface. NASA confirmed that the spacecraft is safe and continues to operate normally after its historic flyby.

  • The Parker Solar Probe flew within 3.8 million miles (approximately 6 million kilometers) of the solar surface, marking the closest approach ever made by a human-made object.
  • The probe reported back to NASA on December 26, confirming its health and operational status after a brief period of silence during the flyby.
  • Launched in 2018, the Parker Solar Probe aims to study the Sun’s corona and the solar wind, contributing to our understanding of solar dynamics.
  • The spacecraft is equipped with a heat shield capable of withstanding temperatures up to 1370°C.
  • Scientists are hopeful that data collected during this mission will illuminate longstanding questions regarding the Sun's atmospheric temperatures and dynamics.
“Parker Solar Probe has phoned home! After passing just 3.8 million miles from the solar surface... we have received Parker Solar Probe’s beacon tone confirming the spacecraft is safe,” NASA stated.

The successful operations and data collection from the Parker Solar Probe contribute valuable insights into solar physics, aiming to unravel mysteries about the Sun that affect space weather and, by extension, life on Earth.
newTitle: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Successfully Completes Record-Breaking Approach to the Sun

Manmohan Singh’s funeral at Nigambodh ghat, Congress calls it deliberate insult to first Sikh PM - The Hindu
summary:
Manmohan Singh’s funeral at Nigambodh ghat, Congress calls it deliberate insult to first Sikh PM

Published on: December 27, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

The Ministry of Home Affairs has ordered a State funeral for former Prime Minister Dr Manmohan Singh at Nigambodh Ghat, which has sparked controversy with the Congress party calling it a deliberate insult to Singh's legacy.

  • Dr Manmohan Singh passed away at the age of 92.
  • The Congress demanded a funeral location suitable for a memorial.
  • The decision for Nigambodh Ghat was made after discussions between Congress leaders and government officials.
  • Senior Congress leaders expressed that the choice of location is viewed as disrespectful.
  • Dr Singh was a highly revered figure, recognized for his significant contributions to India.
“This is nothing but a deliberate insult to the first Sikh Prime Minister of India, Dr. Manmohan Singh,” said Congress communication chief Jairam Ramesh.

The government's decision has sparked a broader discussion about how national leaders are honored in death and the significance of memorials for their contributions.
newTitle: Manmohan Singh's Funeral Sparks Controversy Over Location Choice

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has suspended the head of operations and head of training at Akasa Air for six months due to training lapses related to the use of an uncertified simulator for pilot training.

  • O2 Power has a capacity of 4.7 GW in renewable energy.

  • CEO Parag Sharma expressed excitement about the new partnership and focus on renewable energy goals.
“This marks the beginning of the next phase for O2 Power... We look forward to working with JSW Neo Energy for the next phase.” - Parag Sharma, CEO of O2 Power

title: Driver who killed 35 in China car ramming sentenced to death - DAWN.com
summary:
Man Sentenced to Death for China Car Ramming Attack that Killed 35

Publication Date: Today, Source: State Media

A man who deliberately drove through a crowd of people exercising outside a sports complex in Zhuhai, China, killing 35, has been sentenced to death. The 62-year-old, Fan Weiqiu, was found guilty of venting his anger over a broken marriage and personal frustrations. The attack, which occurred on November 11, was the deadliest in China since 2014.

  1. The defendant was tried and sentenced on the same day, with the court citing the extreme nature of the crime and its severe consequences.
  2. Fan pleaded guilty in front of victims' families, officials, and members of the public.
  3. The attack has sparked anger and discussion online, with some calling for immediate execution.
Fan decided to vent his anger over a broken marriage and personal frustrations, leading to the deadly attack.

The sentencing comes amid a string of mass casualty incidents in China this year, challenging the country's reputation for good public security.
newTitle: Man Sentenced to Death for China Car Ramming Attack that Killed 35

title: Delhi pollution: CAQM revokes GRAP 3 measures as rain improves air quality - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Pollution: CAQM Revokes GRAP 3 Measures as Rain Improves Air Quality

Date: Dec 27, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi's air pollution levels showed a declining trend, prompting the Centre's anti-pollution panel to revoke Stage 3 curbs under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) due to improved air quality brought on by rain.

  • The 24-hour average air quality index (AQI) was 324 at 7 PM.
  • CAQM stated that air quality shifted from 'severe' to 'poor', allowing the withdrawal of Stage 3 measures.
  • Stage 1 and 2 measures will remain in effect to prevent further deterioration.
  • The significant impact of rain is expected to continue improving air quality in the city.
  • GRAP Stage 3 included bans on non-essential construction, hybrid schooling for younger students, and restrictions on certain vehicles.
"Delhi's air quality has shifted from the 'severe' category to the 'poor' range. As a result, measures under Stage III, implemented earlier, are now being withdrawn." - CAQM

In conclusion, the recent rainfall in Delhi has led to a notable improvement in air quality, prompting authorities to ease certain pollution control measures while maintaining vigilance to ensure continued air quality management.
newTitle: Delhi Pollution: Revocation of GRAP 3 Measures Following Rain

title: Congress Seeks Space For Memorial To Manmohan Singh, Writes To PM - NDTV
summary:
Congress Seeks Space For Memorial To Manmohan Singh, Writes To PM

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: Congress Party Statement

Following the passing of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge has reached out to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to discuss the possibility of building a memorial at the site of his last rites.

  • Manmohan Singh passed away at the age of 92 due to age-related issues.
  • He served two terms as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014 under the UPA government.
  • The last rites are scheduled to take place on December 28, 2024, at Nigambodh Ghat in Delhi.
  • Kharge emphasized that this request aligns with traditions of memorializing leaders at their funeral sites.
  • Singh is credited with vital economic reforms that greatly improved India's economic stability.
  • He had a significant role in ushering in various landmark policies like the NREGS and the RTI.
“When the nation was in the throes of grave economic crisis, it was Dr. Manmohan Singh who took India out of the crisis and also led the country towards prosperity.” — Mallikarjun Kharge

This request seeks to honor Singh's legacy as a statesman and a national leader.
newTitle: Congress Proposes Memorial for Manmohan Singh

title: Ola Electric’s CTO, CMO quit adding to top-level exodus - The Economic Times
NASA spacecraft Parker Solar Probe ‘safe’ after closest-ever approach to the Sun - Hindustan Times
summary:
NASA Parker Solar Probe Safely Completes Historic Close Approach to the Sun

Publication Date: Dec 27, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

NASA's Parker Solar Probe has successfully completed its closest approach to the Sun, coming within 3.8 million miles (6.1 million km) of the solar surface and entering the corona. The spacecraft is reported to be in good health and operational.

  • The Parker Solar Probe transmitted a beacon signal confirming its status after the record-breaking approach.
  • The mission aims to enhance understanding of how solar material heats to millions of degrees and the origin of solar wind.
  • Traveling at speeds of up to 430,000 mph, the probe endured extreme temperatures of 1,800°F (982°C).
  • Mission Operations Manager Nick Pinkine noted the unprecedented nature of the probe's journey into uncharted territory.
“This close-up study of the Sun allows Parker Solar Probe to take measurements that help scientists better understand how material in this region gets heated to millions of degrees.” – NASA

This successful mission marks a significant step in solar exploration and understanding the dynamics of our nearest star.
newTitle: NASA Parker Solar Probe Safely Completes Historic Close Approach to the Sun

title: JSW Neo Energy to Acquire O2 Power for ₹125 Billion - Mercom India
summary:
JSW Neo Energy to Acquire O2 Power for ₹125 Billion

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mercom India

JSW Neo Energy has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire a 4,696 MW renewable energy platform from O2 Power Pooling.

  • The enterprise valuation of the platform is approximately ₹124.68 billion (~$1.46 billion).
  • The acquisition includes O2 Power Midco Holdings and O2 Energy SG, pending regulatory approvals.
  • O2 Power operates a renewable energy platform with 4,696 MW capacity, with 2,259 MW expected operational by June 2025.
  • JSW’s generation capacity will increase by 23% from 20,012 MW to 24,708 MW.
“The platform offers a blended average tariff of ₹3.37 (~$0.039)/kWh and an average operational life of approximately 23 years.”

This acquisition enhances JSW Energy's position in the renewable energy sector, positioning it for future growth in clean energy generation.
newTitle: JSW Neo Energy to Acquire O2 Power for ₹125 Billion

Source: NDTV

The pollution curbs in Delhi under GRAP-3 have been lifted due to improvements in air quality following continuous rains. The AQI has shown a downward trend and is expected to remain in the 'poor' category for the next few days.

  • Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) 3 curbs lifted as air quality improves.
  • Continuous rains have contributed to a decrease in the AQI levels.
  • Restrictions on diesel generators and construction activities are being eased, but some areas remain under closure orders.
  • Stage I & II of the revised GRAP will remain in effect to monitor air quality.
“Actions under Stage I & II of the revised GRAP shall remain invoked and be implemented, monitored and reviewed by all the agencies concerned in the entire NCR.”

This move marks a shift in response to improved environmental conditions, as the seasonal pollution issues are still anticipated.

Publication Date: October 2023

In a significant political move, German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier has dissolved the parliament and announced early elections scheduled for February 23, following the collapse of Chancellor Olaf Scholz's coalition government.

  • The coalition, comprised of the Social Democrats, Greens, and Free Democrats, fell apart due to internal disagreements.
  • Steinmeier's decision comes after unsuccessful attempts to stabilize the government.
  • This early election marks a pivotal moment in German politics and could reshape the political landscape.

title: A public health emergency is waiting at the bottom of the antibiotic resistance cliff - Medical Xpress
summary:
A public health emergency is waiting at the bottom of the antibiotic resistance cliff

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: Medical Xpress

The rise of antibiotic-resistant bacteria could lead to a catastrophic increase in infection-related deaths, with researchers warning that the issue of pan-resistant bacteria is imminent.

Key Points

  • The study published in Communications Medicine emphasizes that as antibiotic use has risen, so has bacterial resistance.
  • One hypothetical strain of E. coli could lead to a dramatic rise in sepsis deaths in the U.S. within five years.
  • This problem threatens populations globally, eliminating the advantages of healthcare access in high-income countries.
"Multidrug-resistance is bad, but once a pathogen gains resistance to all known antibiotics...this problem could rapidly become orders of magnitude worse than we've been planning for." - Benjamin Koch

Actions can be taken to mitigate this emergency, including improving antibiotic stewardship and monitoring resistance emergence.
newTitle: A Public Health Emergency Looms Due to Antibiotic Resistance
